qas.question: In the US, what kind of tuner is needed for residents to receive free, over the air programming?
Laws regarding antennas were upated before what?

answers.text: the change to digital terrestrial broadcasts

qas.question: Who do these laws prohibit from banning the installation of antennas?

answers.text: home owners' associations and city government

qas.question: Laws about antennas keep home owners' associations and city government from banning what?
Most television sets sold since what year have an ATSC tuner?
In the UK, what kind of tuner is needed for residents to receive free, over the air programming?
Laws regarding antennas weren't updated before what?

plausible_answers.text: home owners' associations and city government

qas.question: Who do these laws allow the installation of antennas?
Laws about antennas keep home owners' associations and city government from allowing what?

context: In the US, residents in the line of sight of television station broadcast antennas can receive free, over the air programming with a television set with an <a0_0><b5_0>ATSC<b5_0/><a0_0/> tuner (most sets sold since <a4_0>2009<a4_0/> have this). This is achieved with a TV aerial, just as it has been since the 1940s except now the major network signals are broadcast in high definition (ABC, Fox, and Ion Television broadcast at 720p resolution; CBS, My Network TV, NBC, PBS, and The CW at 1080i). As their digital signals more efficiently use the broadcast channel, many broadcasters are adding multiple channels to their signals. Laws about antennas were updated before <a1_0>the <b6_0>change to digital terrestrial broadcasts<b6_0/><a1_0/>. These new laws prohibit <a2_0><b7_0>home owners' associations and city government<b7_0/><a2_0/> from banning <a3_0>the <b8_0>installation of antennas<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
